data.title: Feature Request: Distribute Atom through the Mac App Store
data.body:
IANAL.  Please can anyone confirm whether the [Atom MIT license](https://github.com/blog/1831-atom-free-and-open-source-for-everyone) is compatible with the Mac App Store?

Now that Electron 0.34.0 supports the Mac App Store https://github.com/atom/electron/blob/master/docs/tutorial/mac-app-store-submission-guide.md, is it possible to submit Atom to the Mac App Store so that the app auto-updates?

As of Atom 1.0 to 1.6, the OS X auto-update framework is borked as per https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/2860

Thanks!

data.title: Need a diff package that works with 1.5.3.
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Help me find a diff package that works with 1.5.3. I need to diff files in different root folders, but in the same project.

I've tried:
1) split-diff (splotches of red on one file and green on other, doesn't detect identical lines)
2) compare-files (works only in same project folder, throws an error otherwise - something about an illegal operation)
3) atom-cli-diff (opens an empty temp file, never works)
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line.

Atom 1.5.3.

data.title: Wrong auto-indent behavior
data.body:
I came across this bug when writing in python:

![19](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7478535/13330905/540aeec6-dbfb-11e5-90cf-867a2e4d0705.gif)

``` python
with mutex:
    if condition: print(True)
    else: print(False)
```

Each time something is added after the `else` statement, the line is re-indented.

Similar to #8570

data.title: Update build scripts to use the new railcar branching model
Paste should paste at cursor position, not at the mouse position
data.body:
Hello,
I'm been using atom for a while now and this (together with the double paste problem) is really bugging me. The problem is simple. Whenever I paste something using the middle button, it get pasted wherever the mouse is pointing instead at the cursor position. I tend to use the mouse very little (I'm a vim user, and I'm also using the vim extension with atom), and I ended up with my text being pasted in the wrong spot (often twice, but this is another problem). Can I configure this behavior somewhere, or is this an atom feature that is missing ? Thank you for this great editor.

data.body:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6759650/13323092/df1e21c8-dba5-11e5-8a7a-d2a5bb026dce.png)

The code after the Regular Expression has broken autocomplete and syntax highlighting. And comments have working autocomplete and syntax highlighting.

Please let me know anybody needs more information in order to resolve this issue.

This issue occurred on Ubuntu 15.10

data.title: Atom crashes after loading 30 MB text file
data.body:
[Short description of problem here]

**Reproduction Steps:**
1. I have started atom from start menu
2. It were few files opened
3. I have drag text file (size a bit over 30 MB) and drop it to atom
4. Atom had loaded this file and then after few minutes it has crashed. I didn't do anything with the file which had been loaded

**Expected behavior:**

Atom should not crash and should allow to work on this file

**Observed behavior:**

Simply it crashed

**Screenshots and GIFs**

Screenshot
![atom-crash](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4086823/13319317/2dd10414-dbc1-11e5-9aad-88c83651e3ee.png)

**Atom version:** 1.5.3
**OS and version:**
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 15.10
Release:    15.10
Codename:   wily

**Installed packages:**

I didn't have install any new package. I have only default 77 core packages.

**Additional information:**
- Problem started happening recently, didn't happen in an older version of Atom: I don't know that other versions have this issue because version 1.5.3 is my first version of Atom
- Problem can be reliably reproduced, doesn't happen randomly: Yes
- Problem happens with all files and projects, not only some files or projects: Yes

Config file

> "*":
>   core:
>     themes: [
>       "atom-dark-ui"
>       "atom-dark-syntax"
>     ]
>   editor:
>     invisibles: {}
>   "exception-reporting":
>     userId: "7017a4d7-bd38-cb69-512c-20dee9b90c88"
>   welcome:
>     showOnStartup: false

data.title: Atom hangs when focusing compressed javascript files
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Atom hangs when editing compressed javascript files. Note that files can be opened and closed without Atom hanging, it is focusing the active pane that causes the undefined behaviour.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a minified javascript file
2. Click on the active pane

**Expected behavior:**
I expect the cursor to move to where I click on the active pane.

**Actual behavior:**
Atom hangs, forcing me to ether Force Quit the application or wait until Atom realises it is stuck and then close the application.
### Versions

``` bash
$ atom -v
1.5.3
$ apm -v
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git 2.7.0
```

18  libsystem_pthread.dylib         0x00007fff92764375 thread_start + 13

All the information is in that pull request and related issues.

data.title: Scroll feature doesn't work well in preview pane.
data.body:
### Description

My preview doesn't work well as it always scroll up.
I took a look at `settings` but didn't find anything about the keyword `scroll` for preview pane.
Since it cannot sync correctly, how do I disable the scroll feature? 
### Steps to Reproduce
1.  I open a markdown file with long content, which is over screen height.
2.  enable and display preview pane on right side. 
3.  if I type anything on the edit pane, and preview panel will scroll up immediately and remain the position on the preview pane, such that I cannot see the live result from preview panel, and I have to scroll down to the page bottom to follow up.

**Expected behavior:** 
The preview content should sync with edit pane. 
**Actual behavior:**
The preview content always scroll up and stop the position. 
I have to manually scroll down to follow edit pane.
### Versions

Atom: 1.5.3
Windows 10.

data.title: Installer fails on Windows7 64 pro
data.body:
### Prerequisites

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Atom v1.6.0-beta4 is installed, it shows an update is available but it won't install. Atom didn't even ask to restart to apply the new update.

I have now downloaded v1.6.0-beta5 but the installer fails with an error. Now I don't have any version installed due to installer removed old versions.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Download the current beta installer AtomSetup.exe
2. Execute the installer
3. Receive the error message

**Expected behavior:** I expected the installer to not fail

**Actual behavior:** It removed all old beta versions and failed on install.
### Versions

Atom v1.6.0-beta4
### Error logs

https://gist.github.com/fibric/10b3489ed304a3c5a6a1

data.title: Refactor pending state to live in pane instead of items
data.body:
- ~~New public API `workspace.setItemNotPending` that
  packages can use to set an item to set an item to not pending
  (e.g. when the user interacts with the item)~~
- Pending state for newly opened items with `{pending: true}`
  is now tracked by `Pane` instead of the item, and packages like
  `tabs` that query this information now get it from the Pane.

See corresponding changes:
- https://github.com/atom/tabs/pull/268
- https://github.com/atom/tree-view/pull/741

data.title: Atom launcher shortcut does not work after install on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS
data.body:
### Description

After installing Atom for the first time on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS the Launcher (Unity Launcher) shows the Atom application but the application will not launch when clicked. 

Atom can be executed from a terminal command.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. From Ubuntu 14.04 LTS download the official [Debian package for Atom](https://atom.io/download/deb) from the [Atom website](https://atom.io/).
2. Install the Atom application from the Debian package downloaded by double-clicking on it from a file browser, or by entering the following command in a terminal:
   
   ```
   sudo dpkg --install ./atom-amd64.deb
   ```
3. Once install completes, open the Unity Launcher. 
4. Find the newly installed Atom application and click on it to launch.
#### Actual behavior
- Clicking on the Atom application in the Launcher does nothing. No application opens.
- Right-clicking on the Atom application in the Launcher shows the Application name _Atom_ and a different File icon, but with no buttons to Launch the application and no application description.
#### Expected behavior
- Clicking on the Atom application in the Launcher opens the Atom editor.
- Right-clicking on the Atom application in the Launcher shows the Application name _Atom_, the description _A hackable text editor for the 21st Century._ and a button named _Launch_ that will launch the Atom application.
### Versions

Here are the relevant version strings for Atom and my Operating System.
#### Atom version

```
# atom --version
1.5.3
```
#### Atom Package Manager version

```
# apm --version
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.6
git 1.9.1
```
#### Ubuntu version

```
# lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID: Ubuntu
Description:    Ubuntu 14.04.4 LTS
Release:    14.04
Codename:   trusty
```

data.title: "This TextEditor has been destroyed" when closing a file opened in multiple panes
data.body:
### Description

Opening a file in two different panes and then closing one of them causes the other pane to be uneditable; it throws an exception:

```
Error: This TextEditor has been destroyed
    at DisplayBuffer.module.exports.DisplayBuffer.screenPositionForBufferPosition (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/display-buffer.js:794:15)
    at TextEditorMarker.module.exports.TextEditorMarker.getHeadScreenPosition (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/text-editor-marker.js:179:33)
    at Cursor.module.exports.Cursor.getScreenPosition (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/cursor.js:73:26)
    at TextEditor.module.exports.TextEditor.getCursorScreenPosition (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/text-editor.js:1467:35)
    at TextEditor.module.exports.TextEditor.isFoldedAtCursorRow (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/text-editor.js:2670:44)
    at BracketMatcherView.module.exports.BracketMatcherView.updateMatch (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/bracket-matcher/lib/bracket-matcher-view.js:123:23)
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/bracket-matcher/lib/bracket-matcher-view.js:41:26
    at Function.module.exports.Emitter.simpleDispatch (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/event-kit/lib/emitter.js:25:14)
    at Emitter.module.exports.Emitter.emit (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/event-kit/lib/emitter.js:125:28)
    at TextBuffer.module.exports.TextBuffer.handleChangedText (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/text-buffer.js:1320:20)
    at TextBuffer.module.exports.TextBuffer.transact (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/text-buffer/lib/text-buffer.js:834:14)
    at TextEditor.module.exports.TextEditor.transact (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/text-editor.js:1251:26)
    at atom-text-editor.newCommandListeners.(anonymous function) (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/register-default-commands.js:639:22)
    at CommandRegistry.module.exports.CommandRegistry.handleCommandEvent (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/command-registry.js:260:29)
    at /Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/command-registry.js:3:61
    at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.dispatchCommandEvent (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:570:16)
    at KeymapManager.module.exports.KeymapManager.handleKeyboardEvent (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/node_modules/atom-keymap/lib/keymap-manager.js:378:22)
    at WindowEventHandler.module.exports.WindowEventHandler.handleDocumentKeyEvent (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/window-event-handler.js:98:36)
    at HTMLDocument.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/window-event-handler.js:3:61)
```

Seems to be the same exception (though perhaps not the same cause) as #178.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a file
2. Split a new pane
3. Open the same file
4. Close the newly opened file
5. Attempt to type in the original pane
### Versions

Observed on:

```
Atom    : 1.7.0-dev-5612f1a
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```

and

```
Atom    : 1.7.0-dev-e39d200
Electron: 0.36.7
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```

data.title: Atom freezes when reordering tabs
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I can no longer drag tabs to reorder them. When I do so, Atom freezes. No keystrokes or mouse input is registered, including trying to quit Atom. There is nothing printed to the Inspector console.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open Atom.
2. Open a new file.
3. Drag the second tab to the left of the first tab.

**Expected behavior:** The second tab should have moved to become the first tab.

**Actual behavior:** Atom freezes entirely.
### Versions

Atom version 1.5.3 (OS X).

data.title: TextEditor customization
data.body:
From https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/5503:
- [ ] Donâ€™t grow with content by default (`grow-vertically` attribute).
- [x] Donâ€™t show gutters by default (`show-gutters` attribute).
- [ ] Donâ€™t show invisibles by default (`show-invisibles` attribute).
- [ ] Donâ€™t include 3 line padding.
- [ ] Add `read-only` attribute.

Did I miss anything? Does this seem like a reasonable way forward? /cc @atom/core
## 

This has evolved a bit since :point_up:.

data.title: bug: Atom's interface gets messed up when using Live HTML preview
data.body: Interface gets messed up when using live preview in html. ## Repro Steps 1. Create a new HTML document template (type html, hit tab) 2. Open live preview (ctrl-shift-M) 3. In the HTML document's section create new style as following: ``` html ``` 1. Watch the world burn: Before applying style: After applying style: **Expected:** The preview pane to change only **Actual:** Every element on the Atom interface changes font size ## Versions - **Atom:** 1.5.3 - **OS:** Mac OS X 10.10.5 --- This report was created in and posted from the Atom editor using the package `bug-report` v0.7.1.

data.title: Set Chromium log_level To Suppress Chromium Logs
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?
### Description

Currently, the chromium `log_level` is not explicitly set. This means that the `log_level` is implicitly `0`, which is the most verbose setting. We should set [1] the `log_level` to a level [2] that suppresses INFO and WARNING messages, at a minimum.

[1] `app.commandLine.appendSwitch 'log-level', '<SOME VALUE HERE>'`
[2] https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/master/base/logging.h#292
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Launch atom from the terminal / command line
2. Observe messages like `[852:0224/093645:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command` and `[2804:0224/093645:ERROR:renderer_main.cc(200)] Running without renderer sandbox`

**Expected behavior:** Show only meaningful log messages when atom is launched from the terminal or command line

**Actual behavior:** Spurious log messages are displayed when atom is launched from the terminal or command line.
### Versions

<= 1.7.0-dev
### See Also
- https://github.com/atom/electron/issues/1905
- https://github.com/atom/atom/pull/10950

data.title: return default to default open file behavior
data.body:
In stable, click on a file in the tree, Atom opens a new file tab.
In beta, by default, clicking on the file opens over the active tab sometimes.
Switching `allowPendingPaneItems: default: false` returns behavior to expected from v1.5.x.
ref #10762

Not sure if [these lines](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/ae26e6c8ca284bb2858c65074c8d1d64564d1593/src/workspace.coffee#L417-L418) need to be changed.

data.title: WIP: Fix Issues With atom.cmd On Beta Channel
data.body:
This PR:
- [x] Fixes a syntax error regarding `ELSE`
- [x] Fixes an issue associated with a space being a component of the path to atom.cmd or atom.exe
- [ ] Ensures that --wait exits correctly when used
## 
- Fixes #10934 

/cc @raelyard

data.title: ASCII code not recognizable
data.body: While pressing " Ctrl + Alt + Q " with "Serbian" keyboard, the editor doesn't show the "backslash character", instead I have to switch keyboards in other to get the "backslash character".

data.title: Darwin: "kernel: file: table is full" / ENFILE: file table overflow
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](https://atom.io/docs/latest/hacking-atom-debugging)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

When opening a few projects, Darwin or Atom run out of file descriptors.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open atom in safe mode (or not in safe mode), and Console.app to keep an eye on things
2. Open a few Node projects, containing node_modules folders so there are lots of files in the repos
3. Either you get `kernel: file: table is full` in Console.app or `ENFILE` errors in Atom

**Expected behavior:** Atom should only open the files that it needs, hard to imagine it needs so many that the kernel stutters.

**Actual behavior:** System becomes unstable, needed to reboot
### Versions

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line.

```
$ atom --version
1.5.3
$ apm --version
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.7.0
```
